item.title: Hamas Took More Than 200 Hostages From Israel. Here's What We Know.
item.description: Israel says 97 hostages abducted on Oct. 7 remain in captivity, including the bodies of at least 34.

item.title: Inside Mexico's New Plan to Take On Cartel Violence
item.description: President Claudia Sheinbaum aims to “pacify the country” by targeting fentanyl smuggling and extortion during the first 100 days of her administration.

item.title: Intense Urban Battles Pitch Russia's Numbers Against Ukraine's Agility
item.description: In a high-tech war shaped by drones, precision weapons and electronic jammers, it is still boots on the ground that take and hold territory.

item.title: One Year After Oct. 7, Israel Sees a Future at War
item.description: The Hamas-led attack has convinced Israel that it must take the battle to its enemies.

item.title: Putin's 'Merchant of Death' Is Back in the Arms Business. This Time Selling to the Houthis.
item.description: Russian gunrunner Viktor Bout was traded in 2022 for U.S. basketball star Brittney Griner.

item.title: Israel Launches New Offensive in Northern Gaza, Orders Mass Evacuation
item.description: The operation aims to combat a militant resurgence in the area, said the Israeli military, which also targeted southern Beirut with a night of heavy bombardment.

item.title: A Single Day Changed These Gazans' Lives Forever
item.description: Separated by closed borders, clutching invitations for canceled weddings, Palestinians entered a year of limbo that still has no end in sight.

item.title: Despite Geopolitical Tensions, China Is Big Business for Western Consulting Firms
item.description: Deloitte, Ernst & Young and others have signed thousands of contracts across China as Washington and Beijing seek to untangle economies.

item.title: How This Conflict Mineral Gets Smuggled Into Everyday Tech
item.description: Coltan from militia-controlled mines in Congo is increasingly flowing into global supply chains for smartphones and computers, despite U.S. efforts to stop the use of so-called conflict minerals.

item.title: Is Europe Becoming Ungovernable?
item.description: Political fragmentation is paralyzing the continent’s largest economies.

item.title: Drought-Stricken Countries Kill Elephants to Feed the Hungry
item.description: The worst drought in 100 years drives Namibia and Zimbabwe to conduct culls in national parks to help alleviate an urgent food crisis.

item.title: How the Massacre of Ignored Female Soldiers Came to Symbolize Oct. 7 Failures
item.description: The women stationed at Nahal Oz warned authorities for months about increasingly suspicious Hamas activity, but no one acted.

item.title: Heavy Israeli Airstrikes Target Likely Successor to Hezbollah Leader in Beirut
item.description: Israel aimed at Hashim Safieddine, a cousin of Hezbollah leader Hassan Nasrallah, as the war in Lebanon expands.

item.title: Dikembe Mutombo, NBA Star Known for His Height and Heart, Dies at 58
item.description: The 7’2” player won friends while blocking their shots, and won fans for his towering presence as a trailblazer off the court.

item.title: At Least 70 Dead After Gang Attack in Haiti
item.description: A massacre in a farming town came as gangs expand to rural areas once deemed safe.

item.title: Biden Sidelined as Israel Reshapes Middle East
item.description: White House officials say they are closely coordinating on possible Iranian targets but have been blindsided repeatedly by Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu.

item.title: Iranian Missiles Overwhelmed Israeli Defenses at Some Sites, Analysts Say
item.description: While damage was limited, Tuesday’s strike suggests Iran could cause serious pain if it hits Israel’s civilian infrastructure.

item.title: Nightmares of a Chinese Invasion Inspire Taboo-Breaking Entertainment in Taiwan
item.description: Through TV, books and a board game, the island’s entertainment industry is embracing a topic it avoided for decades.

item.title: Israel Warns Some Southern Lebanon Communities to Evacuate as It Battles Hezbollah
item.description: The Israeli military urged civilians in more than 20 towns and villages across southern Lebanon to leave their homes, expanding its evacuation warnings as it works to push Hezbollah back from the border.

item.title: Key U.S. Military Base Secured as U.K. Returns Disputed Islands to Mauritius
item.description: The British government struck a deal with Mauritius to hand over the cluster of 58 tiny islands in the Indian Ocean known as the Chagos archipelago.
